content.description:
"Aw geez, it's another frickin' bolted crack! This Ten Sleep place is bonkers!"

-Some trad Dad, probably

This route ascends a crack system to an anchor under the headwall and will use many of the climbing techniques in your quiver. Layback, jam, stem, and face climb your way to the anchor. Interesting and varied movement the whole way.

This route is new so expect a bit of dust and lichen.
content.location: On the left side of Metropolis. One bolt line right of Luthor. Starts in the left-facing corner/crack system.

content.description: This route is very continuous without every being easy or too hard.  There are some taxing moves and good pockets to clip from however this is no ladder of pockets and edges and the steepness sneaks up on you like its neighbor to the left.
content.protection: 8 clips of Getting Rich and one for its anchor.  Clip 6 bolts going up the headwall to a sport anchor
content.location: Climb Getting Rich .10c, at the chains climb the right extension up the steep headwall on black and red stone.

content.description: Grandma's Secret Sauce
content.location: Overhanging on the Daily Planet boulder. Should be the first route from the left, closest to the main cliff line. Starts on a steep incline, making the belay slippery

content.description: Climb good pockets up a slightly overhanging face.  Powerful and juggy to the second bolt, crux getting to and clipping the third bolt, then powerful climbing to the anchors.  Short and bouldery.
content.location: Rightmost route on the Daily Planet boulder next to Metropolis.

content.description: In the lighter colored rock.  This route was easier to read from the ground than Poking Lois which climbs the purple/black streak to the right.  Powerful and straight forward, this is loads easier than Poking poor Lois. Fun, bouldery and somewhat sequential.
content.location:
On The Daily Planet Boulder:

Left of Poking.

Between Poking and Choking.

2nd from route from right.

content.description: The right extension to Censor This. Short, fun cruxes and decent rests lead to a difficult boulder problem before the anchor. A great new addition to Metropolis!
content.location: The right extension to Censor This.

content.description: The sheer headwall is steeper than it appears and delivers an incredible pump.  Pull pockets and edges to a devious seam at the top.  Few rests and pumpy as hell.  Holds are clean - wall is a bit dirty, this may become a classic with some traffic.
content.location:
Left of Selling Air.  This is the left extension to Gettin' Rich.

Climb Gettin' Rich to the anchor and step left and mount the steep black headwall.

content.description:
Conquer Judas, then prepare for the boss fight against the full force of MechaJudas!

Fight through a low boulder problem and a difficult clip to establish yourself on the headwall. If you can manage that, your next test is a series of long pulls on decent holds to a final crux right before the anchor.
content.location: Extension to Judas, up the headwall just right of Fortress.

content.description: Climb the crack by whatever technique you choose.  If you jam, the crux comes just before the top, if you layback, I have no idea when it comes.  If you're feeling strong, bring 6 more draws, clip the anchors for pro, and punch it to the second set of anchors for a 5.12 called "Lex Luthor".
content.protection: 9(?) bolts.  Or you could protect it with a double set of cams to #3 camalot.  Yes its a bolted crack.  Yes I'm ok with that.
content.location: The distinctive right facing dihedral at Metropolis with a handcrack in it.

content.description:
Did you think this was Jesus Christ Super Man? Oh no. It's something different, something darker. You've been lead astray.

Step off the ground and into some awkward stemming moves. A low crux leads into easier climbing up high.

While the route isn't very run out, I opted to give it a PG-13 rating because it is new and still needs to clean up a bit.
content.location: Next route right of Jesus Christ Super Man.

content.description:
Left facing hand and finger-sized crack.  I didnt jam it, I lay-backed the flake the whole way.  Scary looking detached block at 3/4 height seems fairly solid.

I bolted a 6 bolt extension up the steep headwall that should check in at 12+/13- providing a 105' pump fest on perfect pockets and edges with a crimp and mono thrown in for good measure.
content.location: Right of Black Narcissist.  Left facing flake/crack system.

content.description: Climb the hand crack to an optional anchor (5.9 to here).  Skip the anchor and follow the flared corner on stems, pockets and finger locks to the upper anchor.  FUN!
Lieback up to 2nd bolt then reach left to transition into the crack system.  Wander up crack and face holds to the top of the flake to find a two bolt chain anchor.
content.protection: 7 clips and and a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
Just left of Jesus Christ Super Jew.

The obvious layback thingy a few feet left of JCSJ, transitioning into a flaring and wandering crack.

content.description: Clip an anchor ring at the end of JCSM and continue up the bulge for 6 more clips. The intial steepest section has the best and deepest pockets. The route is continually demanding without ever being to cruxy. There aren't really any good rests so you have to just keep going.
content.location: Climb Jesus Christ Super Man .10a and continue out the steep bulge.  Just to the right of Black Narcisist .12b/c

content.description:
Extension to Luthor (9+/10-) that heads straight up the left side of the black streak to the top of the wall. Cool climbing on pockets and crimps. A fun, long pitch that deserves more traffic.

B

ring a full 70 meter rope or plan to lower twice
content.location: The obvious extension to Luthor that heads straight up the left side of the black streak.

content.description: Start on Censor This and climb slightly left past the anchors on easy terrain to a hard boulder problem and sustained climbing to the anchors.

Hard slab moves right off the ground lead to easier and more enjoyable climbing up high.

Stick clipping the second bolt is recommended to avoid an awkward fall onto your belayer.
content.location: Right of Jesus Christ Super Jew. Climbs the center of the shield.

content.description:
Bolted crack/flake thingy that flares open at the top enough to accept extra-thin climbers and midgets. Burly boys can just lieback left a bit with generous knobs/edges on either side.

The Huey lists it as "9+/10-," but the lieback felt secure at 9 and my wafer-thin after dinner mint partner said jamming and then squeezing through OW style felt pretty soft, too. Call it a 9 no matter whacha do.
content.location: The very first crack after you scramble down (or around) the Daily Planet boulder. Can't miss it. If you DO come around DP, you'll see that Captain Tombstoner actually does ascend the left side of a huge, tombstone-like flake.

content.description: A black slab split by a thin seam down low.  Techy and thin moves leaning at first to the right of the crack lead to a tough transition to tiny features on the left side of the crack.  After the crack ends the slab moves will keep you guessing all the way to the anchor.

A new addition to Metropolis. A long and sustained climb with multiple cruxes but no real stopper moves. Hopefully your endurance is up to the challenge!

The extension begins with a couple bolts of easier climbing to a decent pocket rest. Then the real climbing begins: a long, sustained section of difficult moves with no rest all the way to the jug at the last bolt. Rest up and balance your way over the bulge the anchor.
content.location: Extension to Trad Dad Destroyer. Climbs straight up the headwall, right of the black streak. One route right of Crux Luthor.
